Sequence Information.Source: in silico screening from human GST protein

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 44.44% similar toOvipinI=A=K: 13%.Activity: Active against Gram-Activity: zone inhibition: Active against Gram- K. pneumoniae ATCC 7637, and Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 29213.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: little hemol.lytic at 100 uM. <20% LDH release at 100 uM. low toxicity to keratinocytes (~80% survival).Structure: CD spectrum is not clear.
Literature Information.Author: Horam S, Raj S, Tripathi VC, Pant G, Kalyan M, Reddy TJ, Arockiaraj J & Pasupuleti M. 2018
Literature Information.Title: Xenobiotic Binding Domain of Glutathione S-Transferase Has Cryptic Antimicrobial Peptides
